review_blob:
Dark brown almost black pour. To be expected. Nose is lots of oats and vanilla. Taste is typical for this style. Oats, barely and hints of vanilla. Overall a decent offering.

-optemoz

Decent pils. Nothing special to see here. Move along. Tastes no different to me than most beers. It's okay.

-optemoz

Bottled - Poured a dark orange with very minimal head. Taste is not exactly what I was expecting from a wheat. Crisp and refreshing but lacking the usual wheat based spices. Overall a good sesh beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Tap Room No. 21 Moes Backroom Wheat Beer

review_blob:
Canned - Aroma is lots of bread and hops. Little light for a Tripel. Taste is quite full bodied with lots of bready malts. Not a real alcohol taste but another 2% would have brought it there. Overall a nice beer from a local micro brewery!

-optemoz

Bottled - Orangey golden haze. Aroma is lots of spicyness and wheat. Taste is your typical Sam Adams wheat with coriander and a spicy finish. Overall very nice.

-optemoz

Pours a cloudy orange with some unfiltered floaties. Nose is lots and lots of peach and so is the palate. At least it's real peach and not that fake peach taste. Would buy again!

-optemoz
beer_name: R.J. Rockers Son of a Peach Wheat Ale

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob:
Bottled - pours an opaque yellow with a white head. Aroma is LOTSSSS of lemon and some mild grains. Palate is crisp and refreshing. Lots of lemon. Almost doesn't taste like beer. This is one of my go to summer brews. A lot of people will crap on this beer but I think it's perfect for what it is. A summer beer. After all, it's named summer shandy.

-optemoz

Bottled - light golden pour. Aroma is lots of wheat and grass. Taste is crisp and refreshing. Very mild beer.

-optemoz

Bottle - this is NOT an ale and I have a wicked headache after one bottle. This is a shite attempt by miller. This is a cider with an aroma of farts. I'm done.

-optemoz

Bottled - Got this in a Blue Moon brewpack. Pours a golden amber color with almost no head. Aroma is citrusy yet bready. Some malts and orange. Taste is a sweet citrusy flavor with lots of carbonation. Overall a nice offering from BM.
beer_name: Blue Moon Valencia Grove Amber Ale

review_blob:
Bottled - Pours a golden hazy color with a lot of sediment and chunks. Nose is hops, grass and lemons. Taste was alright but much to hoppy for my liking. Had a few other ryes that were so dominant on the hops. I'd drink it again if someone gave it to me but wouldn't buy it again.

-optemoz

Bottled - Pour is a deep dark brown with a persistent dark tan head. Aroma is lots of roasted malts and syrup. Taste is of burnt wood, not in a completely bad way, but its a very dark roasts beer. You can definitely tell it was aged in wood. Overall it's a nice selection for someone who likes this type of brew but not for me.

-optemoz

Bottle - Poured a dark ruby red with a fluffy head. Aroma is lots of malt and spices and fruits. You can definitely smell the alcohol. Mouthfeel is very heavy but it's expected from a Belgian ale. Lots of carbonation. Lots of dark malts and fruit favors. Great beer. Will buy again.

-optemoz

Bottle - pour is a hazy orange yellow. Aroma is heavy yeast, wheat and spices. Flavor is LOTS of clove, some banana and yeast. I have lots of hefs, but this one kinda bored me. A lot of people love this here in NC but I wasn't blown away.

-optemoz

Bottle - pours a hazy golden yellow color with a minimum head. Aroma is nice a strong lemon wheat. Taste is a very crisp refreshing almost lemonade flavor. GREAT summer offering from Shock.

-optemoz

Bottle - Pour was a nice golden color with a medium head. Aroma is lacking. Not picking up much but the palate is pretty nice. Nice clear ale. Would drink again

-optemoz

Bottle - let me just say, I LOVE BANANA so I may be a little biased. Pour is a see thru amber with almost no head. Smelled the bottle when I opened and I fell in love. Great sweet banana aroma. The taste is everything I expected and more. I was hoping it wasn't overly sweet and it wasn't at all. Great crisp finish with a bready banana loveliness.. Overall, I could drink this anytime of year and love it 9/10!

-optemoz

Bottle - Pour was a dark amber with almost no head. Aroma is a strong alcohol smell with lots of malt. Palate is pretty smooth. Malty with an alcohol on the back end. Not sure if I taste any chili or spices. Overall this might be the nicest Shock Top selection!

-optemoz
beer_name: Shock Top End of the World Midnight Wheat

review_blob:
Bottle - I had no idea this was a Coors brewed beer. Pour is a dark, clear amber. There's not a ton on the nose but there's some malt I can pick up. The palate is light but it has a hoppiness to it that I wasn't expecting from a Coors offering. Overall pretty stable beer. Not noticing a huge standout taste but an alright beer overall.

-optemoz

Bottle - Pour is a very dark amber. I was surprised to see a take on their original signature "Boston" beer turned into an ale. This has a pretty bland aroma but the taste is nice and crisp. Tastes like a typical Boston "lager" even though its in ale. Overall it's a great session choice! 

-optemoz

Bottle - Pour is a bright golden/orange. Nose on this one is very strong on the spices, similar to what you'd smell from a wheat beer. Palate is quite heavy for an ale. This tastes like a Bavarian wheat beer. Not what I was expecting but very tasty! Overall it's a good beer but not one I'd go to if I was looking to drink alot. 7 out of 10

-optemoz

Had this at a new pub by my house. Draft. Pour is a pretty orange/golden cloudy color. Nice white head. Nose is lots of hops and citrus. Palate is a mild hoppiness with citrus, coriander notes. Overall a very nice, light spring selection. 

-optemoz

I poured this one super cold from the freezer. Dark amber color, not much head. Because of the temp, the nose wasnt strong. Tastes like a watered down Sam. This is a great session beer if you dont want the crappy alternatives like Bud Light.

This beer had a standard pour for an ale. There wasnt much to the nose but the taste was surprising. As it warmed, the malts came out more than anything else. It became heavier as I got to the bottom of the glass. Tasty beer overall but I dont know if Id buy it again.

Bottled - This bottle pours a hazy, golden color with a very minimal head. This beer has virtually no aroma, which is strange to me.. It does have a slight caramel and spicy smell. The taste is pretty bland also.. This beer is a pretty basic wheat beer but NOTHING to rave about.. It would be a nice session beer because its pretty easy to drink and not heavy on the stomach but thats pretty much what id drink it for.

Bottled - I gotta say, I wasnt really impressed with this beer.. With not many gingerbread beers available on the market near me, I really wanted to like this one. The aroma does have a gingerbread smell but its more reminiscent of  a pumpkin ale.. Much of the same flavors also. I would drink this again but I wouldnt pay for it if that sums anything up. Not a favorite but somewhat enjoyable.

This beer pours a very dark orange color. My mistake was pouring the bottom of the bottle in with the rest of the glass, so all the unfiltered wheat is now floating in the glass. Nose is strong, sweet alcohol with caramel notes. Taste is very sweet with a slight bitterness on the back end. Lots of sweet fruit. Honestly, either I havent had a strong beer in a while or the alcohol taste is overpowering. 8 out of 10

Bottled - Pour is a VERY dark, brown/black color with a head that sticks around for a while. The aroma is a STRONG coffee smell with lots of doughy, chocolatey notes. This beer has a BIG taste, reminiscent of a typical black beer/stout. Overall, Id have to say this is one of the best Sam beers Ive had the pleasure to taste. This came in their 2011 Holiday BrewPack. Well worth it!

Bottled  - This is my first review in a LONG time but Im back in the saddle. This beer pours a redish brown with a minimal head. First thing I smell is alcohol, which is strange because its doesnt have a high content. Once it wears off I smell some holiday spice and a little caramel and ginger. The taste is bitter off the start but finishes with a slight sweetness. Overall Id say its a nice holiday ale from Sam. Recommended, although id probably prefer it on tap.

Bottled - This is another sorry ass attempt by a "Big Brewer" to try to attract those of us who actually know what beer is supposed to taste like.. The appearance is the best part of this beer and the only promising thing about this.. It poured a hazy orange which is unexpected while reading "Bud Light" on the label.. But moving along to the taste, lets just say thats where the fun ends... It tastes like carbonated water with a hint of some sort of spice.. I really wish Anheuser-Busch would stick to making cheap, crappy beer that should only be sold at sporting events for 50 cents a pint.. and stop using names of beers that actually taste like "Golden Wheat"

12oz. Bottle.. Bought this one in the "Brewmasters Collection" variety pack. Pours a hazy orange with a bright white head.. Aroma is a floral and fruity smell, but the berry is very apparent.. The taste matches the aroma.. very fruity and tart. It has an artificial taste, almost as if they tried to hard. I dont know, its def not my favorite attempt by Sam Adams but its decent..
Bottled - Pours a dark rusty like color.. Nose is lots of pumpkin spices. Cinnamon, Nutmeg and others.. Taste is wonderful.. lots of pumpkin flavors .. reminds me of fall.. awesome PUNKIN beer !

Bottled - Pours a typical hazy orange...Nose is  a faint fruity smell... Taste is rather bland.. i can taste pomegranate in the aftertaste .. it has a slight bitterness on the sides of the tounge..Nothing special
Bottled - .. Pours a light clean yellow .. Nose is light grassy hops... Taste is a light hoppiness with hints of wheat comming thru.. nice clean easy drinking summer beer..

Bottled - Pour is a clear crisp yellow.. with a med. head... Nose is malty with hints of faint honey... Taste is a typical blue moon with a shot of cinnomon... pretty decent considering im a blue moon fan
beer_name: Blue Moon Honey Moon Summer Ale

review_blob: Bottled - Pours an extremly hazy orange... Lots of orange and spice on the nose..Lots of typical white ale spices.. Citrusy... overall a really good american twist on a great style
Bottled - Nose is lots of hops... Flavor is balanced by a slight apricot taste.. but the majority is an IPA.. not as severe as the 90 min.. but still great.. id get it again

Bottled - Ok.. yet another Budwiser attempt at a nice craft style.. but once again we have Macro-Muck... Pours a very pale and cloudy yellow... Not much to the nose at all.. a little yeast.. Now.. the Flavor?? GROSS.. Very weak and pasty wheat flavor.. NO SPICE whatsoever... Very dry.. this is terrible.. Why do they even try.. just stick to the piss water.. at least people r used to it
Bottled - Pours a deep mahogany.. Nose is STRONG malt.. and the Taste is like sucking on pure sugar... def not a fav

Bottled - This poured a tight black with a dark tan head... The aroma in this beer is amazing.. smells like an ameretto wedding cake... awsome flavor to accompany a stout.. but the flavor lets u down... Its a very astringent tinny almond flavor.. very much like cherry Nyquil.. not enuf roastiness..bad aftertaste... buy it if u want a nice smell.. or save urself the trouble and get an ALMOND CANDLE!
beer_name: Carolina Beer Co. Cottonwood Almond Stout

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Bottled - Pours a basic clear IPA orange with a bubbly head and nice lacing... Aroma is lots of fresh green hops... and more hops.. Taste is lots of bitterness as expected.. with a decent maltiness hidden in the back.. and a nice bite in the finish... Nothing jumps out here.. run of the mill craft IPA

Bottled - Pours an amber with a small white head...very small hint of lime on the nose.. the rest is bready yeast with a little alcohol... the taste is very wheaty and citrusy.. im a fan of the regular blue moon.. and this is a nice spring addition..
beer_name: Blue Moon Rising Moon Spring Ale

review_blob: Bottled - Pours a very light copper with minimal lacing..into a snifter.. Nose of sweet malt and fruit.. Taste is a very slight bitterness tword the end.. with sweet alcohol warmth up front..Lots of malt here... this is a wonderful barleywine from Anchor... i would buy this again

Bottled - Pours a fairly dark copper color with a small head.. LOTS of fruitiness on the nose.. almost like piney bubblegum...Pine is def. in the taste.. but lots of sweet dark fruits.. very different beer..
beer_name: Heather Ales Alba Scots Pine Ale

review_blob: Bottled - Pours your typical gold with a light ruby highlight....Nose is a little hops with a malt background... Upfront i got a very candy like taste.. almost liquorish.. then as it warmed... hops with a little bit of honey.. rather sweet..
Bottled - Pours a dark amber.. Lots of piney hops in the nose... Taste is.. ehh.. bitter hops.. not much balance here... and leaves a disgusting after taste... not a big fan
beer_name: Carolina Beer Co. Cottonwood High Gravity Frostbite

review_blob: Bottled - Pours your typical amberish yellow with a frothy white head... prominent lacing.. Aroma is fresh picked hops...Cascade?..   Taste is a smooth hoppy flavor with a good malt balance and a little hops bite on the back end... Standard APA..

Bottled - Pours a copper red....Aroma is a very faint grassy scent.. Taste is rather weak also....nothing jumps out at all... crappy beer alltogether.. if I was working there .. I wouldnt have released this...
Bottled - Pours a beautiful hazy dark brown with a hugh head... Nose is lots of wheat and fruits..Taste is lots of spicy esters .. banana and malts.. very nice for this genre
Bottled - Pours an extremly hazy orange with lots of floaties....Aroma is strong wheat and lots yeast.... Flavor is a little spicy with some banana... very chewy... decent american wheat
